info.title: Issuing and installing SSL/TLS certificates with a private CA

topic.para: The following procedure outlines the SSL/TLS certificate issuance and installation process using a private CA. Private CAs are useful for verifying entities within your private network or if you do not want to pay a commercial CA. The private CA uses a self-signed SSL/TLS certificate.

step.para: Generate a private key and create a private CA. The first step is to generate a private key for the server—such as a Web server—that will use the certificate. The key is kept secure and used to sign messages and decrypt data.
